knimeNode.name: Imputing Node
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node can be used to impute missing values.

fullDescription.intro: Missing values of the choosen columns can be imputed in various ways. The output table always has the same format as the input table.

tab.name: Options
tab.option:
Choose the method used for imputation
random: impute with random values (from a normal distribution if numeric and more than 10 distinct values, sampled from existing values else)
min: impute with column-wise minimum value
max: impute with column-wise maximum value
mean: impute with column-wise mean value
mice: use mice imputation (for further details see documentation of R-package mice)
knn: use weighted mean of k neighrest neighbours

tab.name: Variables to Impute
tab.option: How many neighbours shall be used for knn imputation
What kind of distance shall be used to determine the neighbourship

ports.inPort: Data table with measurements. Each column represents one measured variable and each row represents one sample.
ports.outPort: Like experiment data but with imputed missing values

views.view: View STDERR and STDOUT of the executed R command
